children.text: There were numerous areas where the builder has marked minor defects for rectification, far too many to be individually documented in this report.

Given that the builder has already identified these items for rectification (which is the purpose of our inspection and report process), it is appropriate that they are given the opportunity to address them.

For your builder to reach completion, at which point they are entitled to receive final payment, they must have completed all of their requirements under the Building Act and provided you with a copy of the Occupancy Permit. They must also have completed your home in a proper and workmanlike manner and in accordance with the plans and specifications.

Until the builder has achieved full compliance with these warranties, the works remain incomplete, and the builder would not be entitled to receive final payment. The outstanding items marked by the builder must be properly addressed in full for your home to reach completion.
